dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A vast sea of stars severas as a backdrop for the Main Ti There is unrest in the Galactic Senate Several hundred solar systems under the leadership of the rebel leader, Count Dooku, have decalred their intentions to secede from the Republic. This separatist movement has made it difficult for the limited number of Jedi Kights to maintain peace and order in the galaxy. Senator Amidala, the former Queen of Naboo, is returning to Coruscant to vote on the critical issue of creating an army to assist the overwhelmed Jedi.

dialogues.text: M'Lady, you are still in danger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This vote is very important. You did your duty and CordГ© did hers. Now come. (she doesn't respond) M'Lady, please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns. They walk away. ARTOO lets out a small whimper

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The massive Senate Building glistens in the afternoon sun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vast rotunda is buzzing with chatter. MAS AMEDDA, the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Order! We shall have order! The motion for the Republic to commission an army takes precedent, and that is what we will vote on at this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything quiets down. The AIDE disperses, and SUPREME C

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...My esteemed colleagues, excuse me... I have just received some tragic and disturbing news. Senator Amidala of the Naboo system... Has been assassinated!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a shock silence in the vast arena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continued) This grievous blow is especially personal to me. Before I became Chancellor, I served Amidala when she was Queen. She was a great leader who fought for justice, not only in this honourable assembly, but also on her home planet. She was so loved she could have been elected queen for life. She believed in public service, and she fervently believed in democracy. Her death is a great loss to us all. We will all mourn her as a relentless champion of freedom... and as a dear friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a moment of silence. ASK AAK, the SENATOR of MAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many more Senators will die before this civil strife ends! We must confront these rebels now, and they need an army to do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A second pod moves into the centre of the area with DARSA AMBASSADOR OF GLEE ANSELM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why weren't the Jedi able to stop this assassination? We are no longer safe, under their protection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Senator ORN FREE TAA swings forward in his pod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Republic needs more security now! Before it comes to war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must I remind the Senator from Malastare that negotiations are continuing with the separatists. Peace is our objective here... not war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SENATORS yell pro and con. MAS AMEDDA tries to calm t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My noble colleagues, I concur with the Supreme Chancellor. At all costs, we do not want war!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Senate goes quiet, then there is an outburst of cheer applause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is with great surprise and joy the chair recognises the Senator from Naboo, PadmГ© Amidala.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Less than an hour ago, an assassination attempt was made against my life. One of my bodyguards and six  others were ruthlessly and senselessly murdered. I was the target but, more importantly, I believe this security measure before you, was the target. I have led the opposition to build an army... but there is someone in this body who will stop at nothing to assure it's passage...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Many of the SENATORS boo and yell at SENATOR AMIDALA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I warn you, if you vote to create this army, war will follow. I have experienced the misery of war  first-hand; I do not wish to do it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is sporadic yelling for and against her statements.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up, Senators... you must wake up! If you offer the separatists violence, they can only show us violence in return! Many will lose their lives. All will lose their freedom. This decision could very well destroy the very foundation of our great Republic. I pray you do not let fear push you into a disastrous decision. Vote down this security measure, which is nothing less than a declaration of war! Does anyone here want that? I cannot believe they do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is an undercurrent of booing... and groaning. SENAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My motion to defer the vote must be dealt with first. That is the rule of law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AMIDALA looks angry and frustrated. PALPATINE gives her a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Due to the lateness of the hour and the seriousness of this motion, we will take up these matters tomorrow. Until then, the Senate stands adjourned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The giant towers of the Republic Executive Building seem

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHANCELLOR PALPATINE sits behind his desk with TWO RED-CL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how much longer I can hold off the vote, my friends. More and more star systems are joining the separatists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If they do break away -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I will not let that happen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if they do, you must realise there aren't enough Jedi to protect the Republic. We are keepers of the peace, not soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Yoda, do you think it will really come to war?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YODA closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worse than war, I fear... Much worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you sense, Master?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impossible to see ... The Dark Side clouds everything. But this I am sure of - (opens his eyes) Do their duty the Jedi will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A muted BUZZER SOUNDS. A hologram of an AIDE, DAR WAC, ap

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The loyalist committee has arrived, my Lord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send them in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all stand as SENATOR AMIDALA, CAPTAIN TYPHO, JAR JAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With you the force is strong... young Senator. To see you alive brings warm feeling to my heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Master Yoda. Do you have any idea who was behind the attack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our intelligence points to disgruntled spice miners, on the moons of Naboo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wish to disagree but I think that Count Dooku was behind it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a stir of surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, M'Lady, Count Dooku was once a Jedi. He wouldn't assassinate anyone, it is not in his character.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is a political idealist, not a murderer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In dark times nothing is what it appears to be, but the fact remains Senator, in grave danger you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PALPATINE gets up, walks to the window, and looks out at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Count Dooku has always avoided any kind of conflict. It appears he has no desire to start a war. Why would he kill you? To what end?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, but everything in my being tells me he was behind it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After gazing out of the window for several moments Palpat Mace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Jedi, may I suggest that the Senator be placed under the protection of your graces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think that is a wise use of manpower during these stressful times?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chancellor, if I may comment, I do not believe the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..."situation is that serious." No, but I do, Senator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chancellor, please! I don't want any more guards!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I realise all too well that additional security might be disruptive for you, but perhaps someone you are familiar with... an old friend like... Master Kenobi...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PALPATINE nods to MACE WINDU, who nods back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's possible. He has just returned from a Border dispute on Ansion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must remember him, M'Lady... he watched over you during the blockade conflict.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not necessary, Chancellor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it for me, M'Lady, please. I will rest easier. We had a big scare today. The thought of losing you is unbearable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AMIDALA sighs as the JEDI get up to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will have Obi-Wan report to you immediately, M'Lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YODA leans into her ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too little about yourself you worry, Senator, and too much about politics. Be mindful of your danger, PadmГ©. Accept our help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the JEDI leave the office, PALPATINE continues to pace

dialogues.text: Oh Annie, you'll always be that little boy I knew on Tatooine.

dialogues.text: Our presence will be invisible, M'Lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am very grateful you are here, Master Kenobi. The situation is more dangerous than the Senator will admit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need more security, I need answers. I want to know who is trying to kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frowning) We're here to protect you Senator, not to start an investigation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will find out who is trying to kill you PadmГ©, I promise you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are not going through this exercise again, Anakin. You will pay attention to my lead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will do as the Council has instructed, and you will learn your place, young one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps with merely your presence, the mysteries surrounding this threat will be revealed.  Now if you will excuse me I will retire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only if he chooses to follow his destiny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He must keep it with him at all times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, Master.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This weapon is your life!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've heard this lesson before...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBI-WAN finally holds out the lightsaber and ANAKIN grabs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, you haven't learned anything, Anakin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I try, Master.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBI-WAN and ANAKIN enter the nightclub bar, and everyone

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do I think you are going to be the death of me?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say that Master... You're the closest thing I have to a father... I love you. I don't want to cause you pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why don't you listen to me?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will. I'll do better, I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you see him him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he's a she...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then be extra careful... (nods to a room) Check it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBI-WAN goes away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going, Master?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To get a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBI-WAN heads for the bar. ANAKIN blinks in surprise, the CLOSE - Somewhere in the room a HAND moves to a pistol in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna buy some death sticks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBI-WAN looks at him. He moves his fingers slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to sell me death- sticks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to sell you death- sticks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBI-WAN moves his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to go home and rethink  your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to go home and rethink my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaves. OBI-WAN lifts the drink and tosses it back. CLOSE. The gun is drawn from its holster and held down ou ANAKIN checks out ALIEN FACES. OBI-WAN signals for anothe The drink is poured. OBI-WAN reaches for it. The gun is r The room is silent. ALIENS rise menacingly from their sea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy... Official business. Go back to your drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly, the ALIENS sit. Conversation resumes. Onstage, TH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBI-WAN and ANAKIN carry ZAM into the alley and lower her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know who it was you were trying to kill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Senator from Naboo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who hired you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZAM glares at OBI-WAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was just a job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That Senator's gonna die soon anyway, and the next one won't make the same mistake I did...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This wound's going to need treatment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who hired you? Tell us... tell us now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZAM glares hatefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a Bounty Hunter called...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a sudden FTZZZ sound. ZAM twitches. She blinks i There is a WEOOSH from above. OBI-WAN and ANAKIN look up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toxic Dart...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANAKIN and JAR JAR stand near the door of the anteroom to bedroom. PADME and DORME move about packing luggage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Representative Binks. I know I can count on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yousa betchen mesa bottums.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coughs, recovers) Oh, pardone-ay, Senator. I mean, I am honoured to accept this heavy burden. I take on this responsibility with deep humility tinged with an overwhelming pride. (pompously) It is not every day that I am called upon to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PADME kisses him on the cheek and gives him a hug. JAR JA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a good friend, Jar Jar. I don't wish to hold you up. I'm sure you have a great deal to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, M'lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAR JAR bows and goes out. As he passes ANAKIN, he flashe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not like this idea of hiding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. Now that the Council has ordered an investigation, it won't take Master Obi-Wan long to find that bounty hunter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frustrated) I haven't worked for a year to defeat the "Military Creation Act" not to be here when its fate is decided.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes we have to let go of our pride and do what is requested of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pride?!? Annie, you're young, and you don't have a very firm grip on politics. I suggest you reserve your opinions for some other time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, M'lady. I was only trying to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie! No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't call me that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've always called you that... it is your name, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Anakin. When you say Annie it's like I'm still a little boy... and I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Anakin. It's impossible to deny you've... (looks him over) ...that you've grown up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PADME smiles at ANAKIN. He becomes a little shy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Obi-Wan manages not to see it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mentors have a way of seeing more of our faults than we would like. It's the only way we grow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get me wrong... Obi-Wan is a great mentor. As wise as Master Yoda and as powerful as Master Windu. I am truly thankful to be his apprentice. Only... although I'm a Padawan learner, in some ways... a lot of ways... I'm ahead of him. I'm ready for the trials. I know I am! He knows it too. He believes I'm too unpredictable... Other Jedi my age have gone through the trials and made it... I know I started my training late... but he won't let me move on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That must be frustrating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's worse... he's overly critical. He never listens! He just doesn't understand! It's not fair!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PADME cannot surpress a laugh. She shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry... You sounded exactly like that little boy I once knew, when he didn't get his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not whining! I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PADME just smiles at him. DORME laughs in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say it to hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a brief silence. PADME comes over to ANAKIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anakin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look into each other's eyes for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Don't try to grow up too fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am grown up. You said it yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANAKIN looks deep into PADME'S eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't look at me like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I can see what you're thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) Ahh... so, you have Jedi powers too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DORME is watching with concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It makes me feel uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, M'lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANAKIN backs away as PADME turns and goes back to her pac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small bus speeds toward the massive freighter docks of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANAKIN and PADME, dressed in Outland peasant outfits, get

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be safe, m'lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Captain. Take good care of Dorme... the threat's on you two now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be safe with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They laugh, and PADME embraces her faithful handmaiden. D

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not me, M'Lady. I worry about you. What if they realise I'm not you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks to Anakin) Then my Jedi protector will have to prove how grown up he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DORME and PADME smile. ANAKIN frowns as OBI-WAN pulls him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anakin, you stay put on Naboo. Do not attract any attention. Do absolutely nothing without checking in with me or the Council.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Master.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Padme) I will get to the bottom of this plot quickly, M'Lady. You'll be back here in no time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will be most grateful for your speed, Master Jedi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PADME gives DORME a last hug. ANAKIN picks up the luggage

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May the Force be with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May the Force be with you, Master.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They head off toward the giant Starfreighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, I'm afraid...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm kinda scared too. This is my first assignment on my own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing to worry about... we have Artoo with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two laugh. OBI-WAN and CAPTAIN TYPHO watch ANAKIN and PADME disappea vastness of the spaceport with ARTOO trundling along behi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope he doesn't try anything foolish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd be more concerned about her doing something, than him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The freighter slowly takes off from the huge docks area o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From high above, light streams down from the lofty ceilin

dialogues.text: OBI-WAN walks past several glass cubicles where work is g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Place the subject for analysis on the sensot tray, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBI-WAN puts the dart onto the traym which retracts into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a toxic dart. I need to know where it came from and who made it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One moment, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diagrams and .... appear on the screem, scrolling past at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) As you can see on your screen, subject weapon does not exist in any known culture. Markings cannot be identified. Probablt self-made by a warrior not associated with any known society.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me? Could you try again please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Jedi, our records are very thorough. they cover eight percent of the galaxy. If I can't tell you where it came from, nobody can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBI-WAN picks up the dart and looks at it, then looks to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for your assistance! You may not be able to figure this out, but I think I know someone who might.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The massive, slow-moving Freighter suddenly zooms away in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The great, gloomy hold is crowded with EMIGRANTS and thei

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep moving! Keep moving!

dialogues.text: ARTOO slips tube into a tub of mush and sucks up a large

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Hey! No Droids!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
