dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, Mom, no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is sweating. PADME leans over to wipe some of the swea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seemed to be having a nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANAKIN looks at PADME a little more closely, trying to se

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Are you hungry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We went into lightspeed a while ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANAKIN looks into PADME'S eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I look forward to seeing Naboo again. I've thought about it every day since I left. It's by far the most beautiful place I've ever seen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PADME is a little unnerved by his intense stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were just a little boy then. It may not be as you remember it; time changes your perception.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think time has given me much more mature feelings to enhance my perception.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It must be difficult having sworn your life to the Jedi... not being able to visit the places you like... or do the things you like...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or be with the people I love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you allowed to love? I thought that was forbidden for a Jedi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attachment is forbidden. Possession is forbidden. Compassion, which I would define as unconditional love, is central to a Jedi's life, so you might say we're encouraged to love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have changed so much

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't changed a bit. You're exactly the way I remember you in my dreams. I doubt if Naboo has changed much either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It hasn't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't wait to breathe the sweet breeze that comes off the rolling hills. Whenever I try to visualise the Force, those hills are what I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANAKIN looks at PADME when he says this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I love Naboo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is an awkward moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (changing the subject) Were you dreaming about you mother earlier, weren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... I left Tatooine so long ago, my memory of her is fading. I don't want to lose it. Recently I've been seeing her in my dreams... vivid dreams... scary dreams. I worry about her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PADME gives ANAKIN a sympathetic look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBI-WAN walks down the street. It is a pretty tough part OBI-WAN comes to a kind of alien diner. On the steamed-up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A young waitress, HERMIONE BAGWA, is wiping off a booth t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for Dexter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HERMIONE'S eyes narrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waddya want him for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not in trouble. It's personal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HERMIONE stares at OBI-WAN. There is a brief pause. Then

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone to see ya, honey (lowering her voice) A Jedi, by the looks of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steam billows out from the kitchen hatch behind the count

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obi-Wan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Dex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a seat! Be right with ya!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBI-WAN sits in a booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want a cup of ardees?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HERMIONE moves off as the door to the counter opens and D

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, ol' buddy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Dex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEXTER eases himself into the seat opposite OBI-WAN. He c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, my friend. What can I do for ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can tell me what this is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBI-WAN places the dart on the table between them. DEX'S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, whattaya know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEXTER picks up the dart delicately between his puffy fin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I ain't seen one of these since I was prospecting on Subterrel beyond the Outer Rim!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know where it came from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEXTER grins. He puts the dart down between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This baby belongs to them cloners. What you got here is a Kamino Kyberdart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kamino Kyberdart... I wonder why it didn't show up in any analysis archive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's these funny little cuts on the side give it away... Those analysis droids you've got over there only focus on symbols, you know. I should think you Jedi would have more respect for the difference between knowledge and wisdom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Dex, if droids could think, we wouldn't be here, would we? (laughing) Kamino... doesn't sound familiar. Is it part of the Republic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's beyond the Outer Rim. I'd say about twelve parsecs outside the Rishi Maze, toward the south. It should be easy to find, even for those droids in your archive to find. Those Kaminoans keep to themselves. They're cloners. Damned good ones, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBI-WAN then picks up the dart, holding it midway between

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cloners? Are they friendly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It depends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On what, Dex?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dexter grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On how good your manners are... and how big your pocketbook is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Starfreighter lands in the giant port city of Theed. PADME, ANAKIN and ARTOO are among the EMIGRANTS streaming

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The speeder bus pulls up and stops. PADME, ANAKIN, and AR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I grew up here, I don't think I'd ever leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) I doubt that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, really. When I started my training, I was very homesick and very lonely. This city and my Mom were the only pleasant things I had to think about... The problem was, the more I thought about my Mom, the worse I felt. But I would feel better if I thought about the palace - the way it shimmers in the sunlight - the way the air always smells of flowers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and the soft sound of the distant waterfalls. The first time I saw the Capital, I was very young... I'd never seen a waterfall before. I though they were so beautiful... I never dreamed one day I'd live in the palace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, tell me, did you dream of power and politics when you were a little girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) No! That was the last thing I thought of. My dream was to help in the "Refugee Relief Movement." I never thought of running for elected office. But the more history I studied, the more I realised how much good politicians could do. So when I was eight, I joined the "Apprentice Legislators", then later on became a Senatorial advisor, with such a passion that, before I knew it, I was elected Queen. Partly because I scored so high on my education certificate, but for the most part it was my conviction that reform was possible. I wasn't the youngest Queen ever elected, but now that I think back on it, I'm not sure I was old enough. I'm not sure I was ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The people you served thought you did a good job. I heard they tried to amend the Constitution so you could stay in office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Popular rule is not democracy, Annie. It gives the people what they want, not what they need. And, truthfully, I was relieved when my two terms were up. So were my parents. They worried About me during the blockade and couldn't wait for it all to be over. Actually, I was hoping to have a family by now... My sisters have the most amazing, wonderful kids... but when the Queen asked me to serve as Senator, I couldn't refuse her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I agree! I think the Republic needs you... I'm glad you chose to serve. I feel things are going to happen in our generation that will change the galaxy in profound ways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANAKIN and PADME walk toward the palace. ARTOO continues

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUEN JAMILLIA is seated on the throne, flanked by SIO BIB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been worried about you. (takes her hand) I'm so glad you're safe, PadmГ©.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Your Highness. I only Wish I could have served you better by staying on Coruscant for the vote.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Given the circumstances, Senator, you know it was the only decision Her Highness could have made.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many systems have joined Count Dooku and the separatists?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About two hundred. And more are leaving the Republic every day. If the Senate votes to create an army, I'm sure it's going to push us into a civil war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's unthinkable! There hasn't been a full-scale war since the formation of the Republic!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you see any way, through negotiations, to bring the separatists back into the Republic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if they feel threatened. The separatists don't have an army, but if they are provoked, they will move to defend themselves. I'm sure of that. And with no time or money to build an army, my guess is they will turn to the Commerce Guilds or the Trade Federation for help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The armies of commerce! Why has Nothing been done in the Senate to restrain them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid that, despite the Chancellor's best efforts, there are still many bureaucrats, judges, and even Senators on the payrolls of the Guilds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's outrageous! After all of those hearings, and the four trials in the Supreme Court, Nute Gunray is still the Viceroy of the Trade Federation. Do those money mongers control everything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember, Counsellor, the courts were able to reduce the Federation's armies. That's a move in the right direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are rumours, Your Highness, that the Federation Army was not reduced as they were ordered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jedi have not been allowed to investigate. It would be to be too dangerous for the economy, we were told.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must keep our faith in the Republic. The day we stop believing democracy can work is the day we lose it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's pray that day never comes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the meantime, we must consider your own safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIO BIBBLE signals. All the other ADVISORS and ATTENDANTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Anakin) What is your suggestion, Master Jedi?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anakin's not a Jedi yet, Counsellor. He's still a Padawan learner. I was thinking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nettled) Hey, hold on a minute!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me! I was thinking I would stay in the Lake Country. There are some places up there that are very isolated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?! I am in charge of security here, M'Lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIO BIBBLE and QUEEN JAMILLIA exchange a look. Something

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie, my life is at risk, and this is my home. I know it very well... that is why we're here. I think it would be wise for you to take advantage of my knowledge in this instance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes a deep breath) Sorry, M'Lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Anakin, amused) She is right. The Lake Country is the most remote part of Naboo. Not many people and a clear view of the surrounding terrain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect. It's settled then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANAKIN glares at PADME. Then QUEEN JAMILLIA gets up, and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continued) PadmГ©, I had an audience with your father yesterday. I told him what was happening. He hopes you will visit your mother before you leave... your family's very worried about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PADME looks worred. They ALL exit down the main staircase

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The main entrance at the base of the huge temple is bustl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bronze bust of Count Dooku, stands among a line of othe On the walls, lighted computer panels seem to stretch int After OBI-WAN studies the bust for a few moments before M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you call for assistance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distracted in thought) Yes... yes, I did...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has a powerful face, doesn't he? He was one of the most brilliant Jedi I have had the privilege of knowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never understood why he quit. Only twenty Jedi have ever left the Order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs) The Lost Twenty... and Count Dooku was the most recent and the most painful. No one likes to talk about it. His leaving was a great loss to the Order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, one might say, he was always a bit out of step with the decisions of the Council... much like your old Master, Qui-Gon Jinn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes. They were alike in many ways. Very individual thinkers... idealists...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOCASTA NU stares at the bust

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing He was always striving to become a more powerful Jedi. He wanted to be the best. With a lightsaber, in the old style of fencing, he had no match. His knowledge of the Force was... unique. In the end, I think he left because he lost faith in the Republic. He believed that politics were corrupt, and he felt the Jedi betrayed themselves by serving the politicians. He always had very high expectations of government. He disappeared for nine or ten years, then he just showed up recently as the head of the separatist movement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interesting... I'm still not sure I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm sure you didn't call me over here for a history lesson. Are you having a problem, Master Kenobi?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I'm trying to find a planet system called Kamino. It doesn't seem to show upon any of the archive charts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kamino? It's not a system I'M familiar with... Let me see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOCASTA NU leans over OBI-WAN'S shoulder, looking at the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Are you sure you have the right co-ordinates?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) According to my information, it should be in this quadrant somewhere... just south of the Rishi Maze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOCASTA NU taps the keyboard and frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No co-ordinates? It sounds like the kind of directions you'd get from a street tout... some old miner or Furbog trader.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All three actually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure it exists?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me do a gravitational scan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBI-WAN and JOCASTA NU studt the star map hologram.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are some inconsistencies here. Maybe the planet you're looking for was destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wouldn't that be on record?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It ought to be. Unless it was very recent. (shakes her head) I hate to say it, but it looks like the system you're searching for doesn't exist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's impossible... perhaps the archives are incomplete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The archives are comprehensive and totally secure, my young Jedi. One thing you may be absolutely sure of - if an item does not appear in our records, it does not exist!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBI-WAN stares at her, then looks back at the map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PEOPLE are passing through the little street, OLD MEN are

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's my house!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PADME starts forward; ANAKIN hangs back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) What? Don't say you're shy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (untruthfully) No, but I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, there are shouts from two little girils, RYOO ( RYOO & POOJA Aunt Padme!! Aunt Padme!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryoo!! Pooja!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PADME scoops up RYOO and POOJA and hugs them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I'm so happy to see you! This is Anakin. Anakin, this is Ryoo, and this is Pooja.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANAKIN and the GIRLS say hello shyly. Then: RYOO & POOJA Artoo!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they see the droid, they hug him. ARTOO WHISTLES and B

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOLA, PADME'S beautiful older sister, comes in from the k

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over her shoulder) They're eating over at Jev Narran's later, Mom. They just had a snack. They'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOLA puts the bowl down on the table, where ANAKIN, PADME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anakin, this is my sister, Sola.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Anakin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOLA sits, as JOBAL NABERRIE (Padme's mother) comes in wi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just in time for dinner. I hope you're hungry, Anakin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's being polite, Mom. We're starving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning) You came to the right place at the right time. Sit down, son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVERYONE sits and starts passing food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Padme) Honey, it's so good to see you safe. We were so worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PADME gives JOBAL a dirty look. RUWEE smiles as he watche

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I know... but I had to say it. Now it's done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, this is exciting! Do you know, Anakin, you're the first boyfriend my sister's ever brought home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rolls her eyes) Sola!! He isn't my boyfriend! He's a Jedi assigned by the Senate to protect me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bodyguard?! Oh, Padme! They didn't tell us it was that serious!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not, Mom, I promise. (glances at Jobal) Anyway, Anakin's a friend. I've known him for years. Remember that little boy who was with the Jedi during the blockade crisis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) He grew up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, when are you going to settle down? Haven't you had enough of that life? I certainly have!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, I'm not in any danger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Anakin) Is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Yes... I'm afraid she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly) But not much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANAKIN and RUWEE are walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes I wish I'd traveled more... but I must say, I'm happy here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Padme tells me you teach at the university?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) Yes, and before that, I was a builder. I also worked for the Refugee Relief Movement, when I was very young.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PADME, SOLA and JOBAL are clearing the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why haven't you told us about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's there to talk about?  He's just a boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A boy? Have you seen the way he looks at you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sola - stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's obvious he has feelings for you. Are you saying, little baby sister, that you haven't noticed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not your baby sister, Sola. Anakin and I are friends... our relationship is strictly professional. (to Jobal) Mom, would you tell her to stop it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) Well, maybe you haven't noticed the way he looks at you. I think you're afraid to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sola's just concerned... we all are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Mom, you're impossible. What I'm doing is important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've done your service, PadmГ©. It's time you had a life of your own. You're missing so much!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANAKIN and RUWEE are walking in the garden. RUWEE stops a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now tell me, son. How serious is this thing? How much danger is my daughter really in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There have been two attempts on her life. Chances are there'll be more. My Master is tracking down the assassins. I'm sure he'll find out who they are. This situation, won't last long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want anything to happen to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PADME throws some things into a bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, this won't take long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to get there before dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PADME goes on packing. ANAKIN looks around the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You still live at home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I move around so much, I've never had a place of my own. Official residences have no warmth. I feel good here. I feel at home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never had a real home. Home was always where my Mom was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANAKIN picks up a framed hologram.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Is this you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hologram shows Padme at age seven or eight surrounded

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was when I went with the Relief Group to Shadda-Bi-Boran. Their sun was imploding, and the planet was dying. I was helping to relocate the children. See that little one I'm holding? His name was N'a-kee-tula, which means sweethear. He was so full of  life,. All those kids were. I did everything I could to save him, but he died... they all did. They were never able to adapt... to live off their native planet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANAKIN picks up another hologram. It shows PADME at age t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) My first day as an Apprentice Legislator. Notice the difference?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PADME pulls a face. ANAKIN grins. She continues packing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBI-WAN walks through the main hallway to the training ar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBI-WAN comes out onto the veranda and stops, watching TW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't think... feel... be as one with the Force. Help you, it will. (he sees Obi-Wan) Younglings - enough! A visitor we have. Welcome him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CHILDREN take off their helmets and turn off their li

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Master Obi-Wan Kenobi, meet the mighty Bear Clan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome, Master Obi-Wan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am sorry to disturb you, Master.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What help to you, can I be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IВ’m looking for a planet described to me by an old friend. I trust him. But the system doesnВ’t show up on the archive maps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An interesting puzzle. Gather round the map reader, younglings. Master Obi-Wan has lost a planet. Find it, we will try...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The map reader is a small shaft with a hollow opening at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is where it ought to be... but it isnВ’t. Gravity is pulling all the stars in this area inward to this spot. There should be a star here... but there isnВ’t.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most interesting. GravityВ’s silhouette remains, but the star and all its planets have disappeared. How can this be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a brief pause. Then a CHILD puts its hand up. YO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because someone erased it from the archive memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ThatВ’s right! Yes! ThatВ’s what happened! Someone erased it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If the planet blew up, the gravity would go away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBI-WAN stares; YODA chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Truly wonderful, the mind of a child is. Uncluttered. To the centre of the pull of gravity go, and find your planet you will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Master Yoda who could have erased information from the archives? ThatВ’s impossible, isnВ’t it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frowning) Much harder to answer, that question is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A water speeder driven by PADDY ACCU, the retreat caretak

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANAKIN and PADME walk up the stairs from where the water ANAKIN and PADME stop at the balustrade. PADME looks out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was in Level Three, we used to come here for school retreat. See that island? We used to swim there every day. I love the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do too. I guess it comes from growing up on a desert planet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PADME becomes aware that ANAKIN is looking at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...We used to lie on the sand and let the sun dry us... and try to guess the names of the birds singing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I donВ’t like sand. ItВ’s coarse and rough and irritating, and it gets everywhere. Not like here. Here everythingВ’s soft... and smooth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He touches her arm. PADME has become receptive to the way

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was a very old man who lived on the island. He used to make glass out of sand - and vases and necklaces out of the glass. They were magical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks into her eyes) Everything here is magical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could look into the glass and see the water. The way it ripples and moves. It looked so real... but it wasnВ’t.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes, when you believe something to be real, it becomes real. Real enough, anyway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look into each other's eyes. He touches her chin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to think if you looked too deeply into glass, you would lose yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's true...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANAKIN kisses PADME. She doesn't resist. She comes to her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shouldn't have done that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. When I'm around you, my mind is no longer my own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the situation... the stress...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obi-Wan's Starfighter is ready for takeoff. OBI-WAN and M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be wary, this disturbance in the Force is growing stronger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am concerned for my Padawan. He is not ready to be on his own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Council is confident in this decision, Obi-Wan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has exceptional skills. The Council is confident in its decision, Obi-Wan. If the prophecy is true, he weill be the one to bring balance to the Force.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he still has much to learn. And his abilities have made him... well... arrogant. I realise now what you and Master Yoda knew from the beginning... the boy was too old to start the training and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBI-WAN hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master, he should not have been given this assignment. I'm afraid Anakin won't be able to protect the Senator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has a... an emotional connection with her. It's been there since he was boy. Now he's confused... distracted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obi-Wan, you must have faith that he will take the right path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBI-WAN climbs into the cockpit of the Starfighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has Master Yoda gained any insight into whether or not this war will come about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probing the Dark Side is a dangerous process. He could be in seclusion for days... May the force be with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YODA sits with his eyes closed, meditating. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. NABOO LAKE RETREAT, LOUNGE, LATE AFTERNOON
dialogues.text: The setting sun touches the mountain peaks. The lake glow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NANDI place dessert in front of PADME. TECKLA does the sa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANAKIN looks up - wide-eyed innocence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PADME scowls at him. PADME jabs at the fruit - ANAKIN sub

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That! Now stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PADME laughs. ANAKIN laughs. She reaches out for the frui

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Anakin!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANAKIN moves his fingers. The fruit flies into his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not really supposed to do that... for fun, I mean. If Master Obi-Wan were here, he'd be very grumpy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANAKIN is pleased. He cuts the fruint into several pieces

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fire blazes in the open hearth. PADME is sitting in fro She looks up as ANAKIN arrives. She makes room for him. B

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I tell you something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then how can I tell you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should use your Jedi intuition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't work around you. My mind is always a muddle... I can only think of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anakin, don't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the moment I met you, all those years ago, a day hasn't gone by when I haven't thought of you. And now that I'm close to you again, I'm in agony. The closer I get to you, the worse it gets. The thought of not being with you mskes my stomach turn over - my mouth goes dry. I feel dizzy. I can't breathe. I'm haunted by the kiss you should never have given me. My heart is beating, hoping that kiss will not become a scar. You are in my very soul, tormenting me. What can I do? I will do anything you ask...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. The logs flame in the hearth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) If you are suffering as much as I am, tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I can't. We can't. It's just not possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything's possible. Padme, please listen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You listen. We live in a real world. Come back to it. You're studying to become a Jedi Knight. I'm a Senator. If you follow your thoughts through to conclusion, they will take us to a place we cannot go... regardless of the way we feel about each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you do feel something! There's an extraordinary connection between us. You can't deny that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie, it doesn't make any difference. Jedi aren't allowed to marry. You swore an oath, remember? You'd be expelled from the Order. I will not let you give up your responsibilities... your future, for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was destined to be a Jedi. I don't think I could be anything else. But you are asking me to be rational. That is something I know I cannot do. I wish I could wish my feelings away... but I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not going to give into this. I'm not going to throw my life away. I have more important things to do than fall in love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is silence as they stare at the fire. ANAKIN is thi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wouldn't have to be that way... we could keep it a secret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we'd be living a lie - one we couldn't keep even if we wanted to. Mt sister saw it. So did my mother. I couldn't do that. Could you, Anakin? Could you live like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...No, you're right. It would destroy us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just like the star map hologram, plus the storm-shro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heavy rans and hard-driving winds lash the platform as Ob The Starfighter lands. OBI-WAN gets out and makes his way

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Brilliant white light. OBI-WAN pushes the soaking hood

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to Tipoca City, Master Jedi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBI-WAN wipes the rain from his face and blinks in surpri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything is ready. The Prime Minister expects you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (warily) I'm expected?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course! He is anxious to see you. After all these years, we were beginning to think you weren't coming. Now please, this way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBI-WAN masks his surprise as they move away along the co Obi-Wan follows Taun We cautiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door slides open. OBI-WAN and TAUN WE enter and cross

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I present Lama Su, Prime Minister of Kamino... and this is Master Jedi...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obi-Wan Kenobi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAMA SU indicates a chair. OBI-WAN sits. TAUN WE hovers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I trust you are going to enjoy your stay. We are most happy you have arrived at the best part of the season.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You make me feel most welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now to business. You will be delighted to hear we are on schedule. Two hundred thousand units are ready, with another million well on the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (improvising) That is... good news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please tell your Master Sido-Dyas that we have every confidence his order will be met on time and in full. He is well, I hope?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry Master - ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jedi Master Sifo-Dyas. He's still a leading member of the Jedi Council, is he not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes. Sido-Dyas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising) You must be anxious to inspect the units for yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PADME and ANAKIN are in the middle of an idyllic hilly me Beyond is the shimmering expanse of the lake. Several oth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure you do... you just don't want to tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to use one of your Jedi mind tricks on me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They only work on the weak-minded. You are anything but weak-minded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right... his name was Palo. I was twelve. We were both in the Legislative Youth Program. He was a few years older then I... very cute... dark curly hair... dreamy eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, I get the picture... whatever happened to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went on to become a Queen. He went on to become an artist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he was the smart one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really don't like politicians, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like two or three, but I'm not really sure about one of them. (smiling) I don't think the system works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How would you have it work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need a system where the politicians sit down and discuss the problems, agree what's in the best interests of all the people, and then do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is exactly what we do. The trouble is that people don't wlways agree. In fact, they hardly ever do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then they should be made to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By whom? Who's going to make them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone wise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sounds an awful lot like a dictatorship to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mischievious little grin creeps across his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if it works...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PADME stares at ANAKIN. He looks back at her, straight-fa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're making fun of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) On no, I'd be much too frightened to tease a Senator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so bad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PADME picks up a piece of fruit and throws it at him. He

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're always so serious. Always carrying the weight of the universe on your shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANAKIN then starts to juggle the fruit. PADME laughs and ANAKIN stands in front of a SHAAK, yelling at it and wavi The SHAAK crosses in front of PADME. ANAKIN is riding it, ANAKIN stands up and holds out his hand to her. She take

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBI-WAN, LAMA SU and TAUN WE come out onto a balcony. Bel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beaming) Magnificent, aren't they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBI-WAN nods slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAMA SU conducts OBI-WAN through a large eating area. TAU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We modified their genetic structure to make them less independent than the original host. As a result they are totally obedient, taking any order without question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was the original host?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bounty hunter called Jango Fett. We felt a Jedi would be the perfect choice, but Sido-Dyas hand- picked Jango Fett himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is this bounty hunter now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, we keep him here. After a few hundred thousand clones, the genetic pattern starts to fade, so we take a fresh supply. He lives here, but he's free to come and go as he pleases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tour continues through a long corridor folled with na

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apart from his pay, which is considerable, Fett demanded only one thing - an unaltered clone for himself. Curious isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unaltered?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pure genetic replication. No tampering with the structure to make it more docile... and no growth acceleration...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would like to meet this Jango Fett.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would be most happy to arrange it, for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TAUN WE bows, and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tour continues through a classroom filled with IDENTI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mentioned growth acceleration...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes, it's essential. Otherwise, a mature clone would take a lifetime to grow. Now, we can do it in half the time. Those items you saw on the parade ground were started ten years ago, when Sido-dyas first placed the order, and they're already mature...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBI-WAN looks at the BOY CLONES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And these?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About five years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter a space filled with great racks of glass spher

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're immensely superior to droids, capable of independent thought and action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very impressive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd hoped you would be pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBI-WAN gazes at the nearest embryos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (carefully) Tell me, prime minister, when my Master Sido-dyas first contacted you, did he say the order was for... himself... or?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Himself? Of course not. This army is for the Republic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (astonished) The Repubic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are also very much agasint this Count Dooku and his seccessionist movement. We are proud to be of help to the Republic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TAUN WE shows OBI-WAN into his room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have arranged for you to meet Jango Fett in the morning. Sleep well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TAUN WE goes. The door slides closed behind him. OBI-WAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arfour, Arfour...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The R4 D17, Obi-Wan's Astro-Droid, who is sitting on top

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBI-WAN hears ARFOUR BEEP through his comlink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arfour, relay this, "scramble code five," to Courscant: care of "the old folks home."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARFOUR BEEPS and WHISTLES. The panels light up inside the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YODA and MACE WINDU listen as a hologram of OBI-WAN stand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I've never heard of a Jedi called Sido-Dyas, have you, Master?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Whoever placed that order was not a Jedi, I can assure you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a strong feeling that this bounty hunter is the assassin we're looking for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who he is working for... discover that, you must.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will, Master, and I will also find out more about this clone army... May The Force...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hologram switches off, and OBI-WAN fades away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A clone army! Ordered by someone in the Senate perhaps... Someone's out to start a war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inform the chancellor of this, we must.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who do you think this impostor Sido-Dyas, could be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YODA stares back at MACE WINDU, then slowly shakes his he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The silent lodge. The triple moons of Naboo reflected in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANAKIN moves restlessly in his sleep. He mutters to himse forms on his forehead. He turns violently. He cries out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...No...No...Mom!...Don't, no, don't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANAKIN is on the balcony overlooking the gardens. After a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes closed) Don't go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to disturb you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your presence is soothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brief pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had a nightmare again last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jedi don't have nightmares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANAKIN'S opens his eyes and looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw my mother. I saw her as clearly as I see you now. She's suffering, Padme. She is in pain...They're killing her! (getting up) I know I'm disobeying my mandate to protect you, Senator. I know I will be punished and possibly thrown out of the Jedi Order, but I must go. I have to help her! I'm sorry, Padme. I don't have a choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie, I told you I wouldn't let you give up your future for me. I'll go with you. That way you can continue to protect me, and you won't be disobeying your mandate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Master Obi-wan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PADME smiles and takes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we won't tell him, will we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANAKIN and PADME step onto the landing platform from the PADDY ACCU drives the water speeder away from the platfor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rain lashes the city. Below, mightly waves pound the stil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TAUN WE conducts OBI-WAN to the door of Jango Fett's apar As they wait, OBI-WAN notes the door lock entry mechanism

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boba, is your father here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a brief pause, then BOBA FETT nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) May we see him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another brief pause, then BOBA FETT steps aside, and TAUN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBI-WAN, TAUN WE, and BOBA FETT enter the apartment. OBI-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad! Taun We's here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANGO FETT comes in from the bedroom. He wears a jumpsuit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome back, Jango. Was your trip productive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fairly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBI-WAN and JANGO FETT size each other up. BOBA FETT stud

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Jedi Master, Obi-Wan Kenobi. He's come to check on our progress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANGO FETT'S eyes fix OBI-WAN coldly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your clones are very impressive. You must be very proud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just a simple man, trying to make my way in the universe, Master Jedi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't we all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBI-WAN eyes the half-open bedroom door, through which a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Ever made your way as far into the interior as Coruscant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once or twice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Recently?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes Obi-Wan carefully) Possibly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you must know Master Sido- Dyas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boba, close the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOBA FETT moves to close the bedroom door. JANGO FETT smi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Master who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sido-Dyas. IsnВ’t he the Jedi who hired you for this job?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never heard of him. I was recuited by a man called Darth Tyranus on one of the moons of Bogden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No? I thought...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sido-Dyas told us to expect him. And he showed up just when your Jedi Master said he would. We have kept the JediВ’s involvement a secret until your arrival, just as your Master requested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curious...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you like your army?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It seems to me it's your army - being that they are all clones of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning) They'll do their job well, I'll guarantee that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I look forward to seeing them in action. Thank you for your time, Jango.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always a pleasure to meet a Jedi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBI-WAN and TAUN WE go out. The door slides closed. JANGO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Naboo Starship heads toward the desert planet of Tato

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Naboo Starship lands in a large parking lot of Spaces

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the droid driver) Wait, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANAKIN and PADME get down. Sitting on a stool in front of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling, in Huttese) No, not that one - that one!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (arriving) Excuse me, Watto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Huttese) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Huttese) I said excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WATTO turns to the chattering PIT DROIDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Huttese) Shut down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PIT DROIDS snap into their storage position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing, in Huttese) What? I don't know you... What can I do for you? You look like a Jedi. Whatever it is... I didn't do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WATTO drops the screwdriver and curses loudly in Huttese

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me help you with that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANAKIN takes the fiddly piece of equipment and starts to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I'm looking for Shmi Skywalker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WATTO looks at him suspiciously. He stares at PADME, then

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie?? Little Annie?? Naaaah!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the fiddly piece of equipment in Anakin's hands

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; in English) You are Annie! It is you! You little womp rat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WATTO gives ANAKIN a big hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You sure sprouted Weehoo! A Jedi! Waddya know? Hey, maybe you couldda help wit some daedbeats who owe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. Shmi... she's not mine no more. I sold her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sold her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Years ago. Sorry, Anne, but you know, business is business. Sold her to a moisture farmer named Lars. Least I think it was Lars. Believe it or not, I heard he freed her and married her. Can ya beat that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know where they are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long way from here... someplace over on the other side of Mos Eisley, I think...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANAKIN'S grim look means business; WATTO gets the hint qu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... sure... absolutely. Let's go look in my records.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANAKIN and WATTO go into the shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waves crash against the water city as the storm conti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBI-WAN stands with LAMA SU and TAUN WE just inside the o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell your Council the first battalions are ready. And remind them that if they need more troops, we will need time to grow them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't forget.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBI-WAN comes out from the tower into the driving ran. Th Below, a huge wave crashes against the stilts. Spray flie

dialogues.text: OBI-WAN enters cautiously from outside. Ahead, the corrid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBI-WAN walks in to find the room in complete disorder. T OBI-WAN goes to an ultra-thin computer screen. He punches

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad!!
